meanings.definition: The response of an organism to the length of day or night, affecting growth, reproduction, and behavior.
meanings.sent1: The farmer studied the photoperiodisms of his crops to understand their growth patterns.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are researching how photoperiodisms influence animal behavior in different seasons.
meanings.sent3: The photoperiodisms of the flowers made them bloom at unexpected times, surprising the gardeners.
meanings.sent4: In the world of plants, photoperiodisms act like a clock, signaling when to flower and when to rest.
meanings.sent5: Understanding photoperiodisms is crucial for farmers to optimize crop production throughout the year.

meanings.definition: The ability of an organism to sense and respond to changes in day length.
meanings.sent1: Birds' migration patterns are guided by their photoperiodisms, helping them navigate long distances.
meanings.sent2: Zoos often simulate natural photoperiodisms to ensure the well-being of animals in captivity.
meanings.sent3: The photoperiodisms of the owl made it hoot at the same time every evening, amusing the forest creatures.
meanings.sent4: For some animals, photoperiodisms are like a built-in compass, guiding them through seasonal changes.
meanings.sent5: The researcher observed the photoperiodisms of insects to understand their daily routines better.

meanings.definition: The study of how organisms use day length to regulate biological processes.
meanings.sent1: Botanists delve into photoperiodisms to uncover how plants adapt to changing environmental conditions.
meanings.sent2: The course on photoperiodisms provided insights into how animals synchronize their activities with daylight.
meanings.sent3: The professor's fascination with photoperiodisms led to some quirky experiments in the lab.
meanings.sent4: In the realm of biology, photoperiodisms are like conductors orchestrating the symphony of life.
meanings.sent5: Exploring photoperiodisms opens up new avenues for understanding the intricate balance of nature.
